text: Oddly, Al Smith's most enduring legacy might be annual Al Smith dinners, first held in 1945, traditionally capping presidential campaigns.

Terribly dour group of tree-lighters.  They used to get kids to do it. Now it's real estate moguls. #RockCenterXmas
For three years 1953-55, the #RockCenterXmas tree lighting was actually incorporated into the Howdy Doody Show.
Lighting #RockCenterXmas tree used to be like last minute shopping. In 1934, according to NY Times, lights were turned on Dec 19.
First official #RockCenterXmas tree in 1933, but workman put makeshift tree at excavation site in 1931, received paychecks in front of it.
After WWII, #RockCenterXmas lighting resumed. In 1945 flourescent painted bulbs were used, creating an oddly unseasonal black light effect.
Due to energy crisis, #RockCenterXmas tree in 1973 decorated w. 25 percent fewer lights, shut off before midnight in symbolic gesture.
Rockefeller Center Christmas tree lighting was broadcast on TV for first time on Dec. 11, 1951, w. musical guest Kate Smith! #RockCenterXmas
